links.body: The Siege of the North, Part 2

paragraphs.body: The baboon spirit is an anthropomorphic resident of the ${link_0}, often found meditating near the ${link_1}. He speaks with a distinct accent and is very irritable, greatly disliking being disrupted during meditation.
paragraphs.text: The baboon spirit is an anthropomorphic resident of the Spirit World, often found meditating near the Realm of Koh. He speaks with a distinct accent and is very irritable, greatly disliking being disrupted during meditation.

paragraphs.body: When ${link_0} arrived in the Spirit World seeking advice on how to defeat the ${link_1} that was attacking the ${link_2}, he asked the baboon spirit for help, but the spirit wanted him to leave. Aang kept persisting for the cranky spirit to help him, but the baboon spirit only grew more agitated as he tried to continue his meditation. When Aang was still hanging around, the spirit told him to follow a ${link_3} and remarked, "Finally!" when he left. After losing the light, Aang was advised by ${link_4} ${link_5} to see ${link_6}, the Face Stealer. After Aang came back from his encounter with Koh, ${link_7} helped him return to the ${link_8}. The baboon spirit remarked, "Good riddance!" much to the annoyance of Hei Bai, who transformed into his monstrous form and struck the baboon spirit with a huge energy blast, sending him flying.
paragraphs.text: When Aang arrived in the Spirit World seeking advice on how to defeat the Fire Nation that was attacking the Northern Water Tribe, he asked the baboon spirit for help, but the spirit wanted him to leave. Aang kept persisting for the cranky spirit to help him, but the baboon spirit only grew more agitated as he tried to continue his meditation. When Aang was still hanging around, the spirit told him to follow a ball of light and remarked, "Finally!" when he left. After losing the light, Aang was advised by Avatar Roku to see Koh, the Face Stealer. After Aang came back from his encounter with Koh, Hei Bai helped him return to the mortal world. The baboon spirit remarked, "Good riddance!" much to the annoyance of Hei Bai, who transformed into his monstrous form and struck the baboon spirit with a huge energy blast, sending him flying.

paragraphs.body: The baboon spirit directed Aang to Avatar ${link_0} on Aang's second adventure through the Spirit World, although Aang does not remember it.
paragraphs.text: The baboon spirit directed Aang to Avatar Kuruk on Aang's second adventure through the Spirit World, although Aang does not remember it.

paragraphs.body: The baboon spirit always prefers tranquility to aid him in his meditation and hates to be disturbed. If someone disrupts this serenity, the spirit will attempt to ignore them and remain unhelpful in order to continue with his meditation. This quality was shown when Aang entered the Spirit World, attempting to locate the identity of the ${link_0} and ${link_1} Spirits; Aang turned to the baboon spirit for help, but the spirit simply brushed off his request and attempted to return to his meditation. When Aang finally left, the spirit felt relieved.
paragraphs.text: The baboon spirit always prefers tranquility to aid him in his meditation and hates to be disturbed. If someone disrupts this serenity, the spirit will attempt to ignore them and remain unhelpful in order to continue with his meditation. This quality was shown when Aang entered the Spirit World, attempting to locate the identity of the Moon and Ocean Spirits; Aang turned to the baboon spirit for help, but the spirit simply brushed off his request and attempted to return to his meditation. When Aang finally left, the spirit felt relieved.
